intro: Struthiola longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered struthiola, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a distinctive waxy coating. Struthiola longiflora is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
